sub_title: Assistant Professor in Computer Architectures and Edge AI
summary:
I am interested in unconventional computing technologies, specifically neuromorphic hardware.

I am working towards a new generation of computing architectures for edge computing applications. Development and optimization of deep neural network and bio-inspired algorithms in neuromorphic hardware. Optimization of neural network architectures tailored towards embedded solutions for real-time machine vision, biomedical and robotic applications.

Specialties: Problem Solving and Technology Assessment.

profile_positions.description: Assistant Professor in Computer Architectures and Edge AI
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: I took part in the development of the next generation of neuromorphic solutions. My focus was on developing innovative neural network algorithms, hardware, and application prototypes in combination with IMEC state-of-art components. Apart from designing embedded prototypes, I conducted research on new neural network architectures, both in hardware and software. I collected the requirements from various stakeholders and build hardware and software solutions. Additionally, I demonstrated these new designs and concepts by building compelling demonstrators.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

profile_positions.description: Inilabs invents, produces, and sells neuromorphic technologies. CMOS mixed-signal design of VLSI devices: neuromorphic processors and silicon retinas. Prototypes R&D, PCB design. Neuromorphic electronic engineering expert.
profile_positions.title: R&D Scientist

profile_positions.description: I am working towards a new generation of brain-inspired computing platforms, i.e., neuromorphic processors.
profile_positions.title: Postdoc

profile_positions.description: (p/t) My primary task is remote administration of Linux and Windows web servers based on various open-source platforms. I'm also involved in strategical planning and web technologies assessment as a consultant.
profile_positions.title: System Administrator

profile_positions.location: Inst. of Neuroinformatics, ETH and Univ. of Zurich
profile_positions.description: Interdisciplinary research at the interface between neuroscience and neuromorphic engineering. Interested in answering basic research questions that are related to the way neural circuits carry out computation and at the same time in developing a new generation of computing technologies based on neuromorphic circuits on CMOS VLSI technology.
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description: I performed my MSc Thesis under Prof. P. del Giudice and Prof. L. Zanello. I’ve been working with neuromorphic hardware simulating Artificial Neural Networks on the configurable VLSI chip FLANN [http://neural.iss.infn.it] and using the asynchronous temporal contrast silicon retina [http://siliconretina.ini.uzh.ch] to present the stimuli at the network. The title of my MSc thesis is “Attractor Dynamics in a neural network of spiking neurons on VLSI neuromorphic chip. “
profile_positions.title: MSc Student
